# Date.FormatStyle.TimeStyle

**Structure**

Type that defines time styles varied in length or components included.

## Declaration

```swift
struct TimeStyle
```

## Overview

The exact format depends on the locale. Possible time styles include [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/TimeStyle/omitted], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/TimeStyle/shortened], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/TimeStyle/standard], and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/TimeStyle/complete].

The following code sample shows a variety of time style format results using the `en_US` locale.

```swift
let meetingDate = Date()
meetingDate.formatted(date: .numeric, time: .omitted)
// 10/17/2020
 
meetingDate.formatted(date: .numeric, time: .shortened)
// 10/17/2020, 9:54 PM
 
meetingDate.formatted(date: .numeric, time: .standard)
// 10/17/2020, 9:54:29 PM
 
meetingDate.formatted(date: .numeric, time: .complete)
// 10/17/2020, 9:54:29 PM CDT

meetingDate.formatted()
// 10/17/2020, 9:54 PM

```

The default time style is [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/TimeStyle/shortened].

## Modifying a Time Style

- **complete**: A time style with all components represented.
- **omitted**: A time style with no time-related components represented.
- **shortened**: A shortened time style with only the hour, minute, and day period components represented.
- **standard**: A time style with all components except the time zone represented.

## Comparing Time Styles

- **==(_:_:)**: Returns true if the two `Date` values represent the same point in time.

## Specifying the Time Format

- **hour(_:)**: Modifies the date format style to use the specified hour format style.
- **minute(_:)**: Modifies the date format style to use the specified minute format style.
- **second(_:)**: Modifies the date format style to use the specified second format style.
- **secondFraction(_:)**: Modifies the date format style to use the specified second fraction format style.
- **timeZone(_:)**: Modifies the date format style to use the specified time zone format style.

## Conforms To

- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
